defs: animal excrement put on or into the soil to fertilise it; manure.

ಎರುಬುಹುಳು erubu huḷu any of a number of oligochaetous worms that burrow in the soil, esp. of Lumbricus genus, very important in aerating and fertilizing the soil; an earthworm; 2. a grub or larva that lives and develops in manure; a muck-worm.
to cause to flow (a liquid) in a continuous stream; to pour.
to bathe; to wash.
to ask or seek earnestly or pleadingly; to solicit; to beg (for).
a thick, black oil used as a lubricant for the wheels of bullock-carts.
a tract of land with black soil.

food for snakes, birds, etc.

an irrigated tract of land with black soil.

the quality or state of being stupid; stupidity.
the quality or state of being modest; modesty esp. a) unassuming or humble behaviour; b) lack of excesses or pretensions; moderation.
loss of respect; public dishonour; disrepute; shame; disgrace.

any of various kinds of greasy, combustible substances obtained from animal, vegetable, and mineral sources, which are liquid at ordinary temperatures and soluble in certain organic solvents, as ether, but not in water; oil.
height - a) the distance from bottom to the top of something standing upright; b) the extent of elevation above a level.

the chest - a) that part of the mammalian body between the neck and the abdomen in whose cavity the heart and lungs lie; b) the middle of the three chief divisions of the body of an insect or the corresponding part of a crustacean or an arachnid; c) the fore or ventral part of the body between the neck and the abdomen in humans.
